radiographic_examinations.findings: Bibasilar atelectasis; extensive atherosclerotic calcification of the mitral annulus and coronary arteries; pronounced atherosclerotic calcification throughout the abdomen; native pancreas not identified; native kidneys markedly atrophic; diffuse hypodensity throughout the mesentery suggestive of diffuse edema; periportal edema noted through the liver; transplant kidney present in the left lower quadrant enhancing and excreting contrast with no hydronephrosis; hypodense tubular structures adjacent to urinary bladder likely anastomosed duodenum; mural thickening and surrounding fat stranding suggestive of surrounding edema; transplanted pancreatic tissue unremarkable with no ductal dilation; no free gas in abdomen or pelvis; no discernable abscess.
